intro: Chartolepis lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chartolepis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from violet to red, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chartolepis lancifolia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
